chargeHist.descr: Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth
Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J. Flasch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF246, 15CF40 and 14CT85 @ 4:09 p.m. State moves to amend ct 1 of 14CF246 - amended information filed. Def will plead to 1 & 4, move to dismiss cts 2 & 3 w/prejudice and cts 5 & 6 dismiss and read in.  15CF40 dismiss and read in. 14CT85 dismiss without prejudice. 14CF246 -Ct 1 - withheld sentence, 5 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, costs. Def bound to recommend no less than 3 yrs probation.  Ct 4 - State will recommend 8 months jail. Def to recommend not less than 4 months jail. Response by Atty Schuster, willing to agree to 5 yr probation and 4 months jail if State is willing. State agrees. Atty Schuster explains why sentencing will not be today. State explains reasons for agreement. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to14CF246 ct 1 as amended - no contest. Plea to ct 4 - no contest. 14CF246 dismissed w/prejudice ct2 & 3, ct 5 & 6 DRI. 14CT85 - dismissed w/out prejudice for reasons stated. 15CF40 - all cts dismissed and read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Schuster satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of cts 1 & 4 of amended complaint.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF40, 14CT85 & 14CF246  @ 11:30 am. 14CT85 Stipulate for hearing probable cause to arrest for OWI however the consent.  Court will hear motion to suppress on 14CT85.  Kyle Rustick, Police Officer for City of Antigo, duly sworn on oath, testifies. State Exhibit #1 - Informing the Accused. State rest.  Atty Schuster would like Officer to check if audio.  Atty Schuster will file brief. Court will due a oral ruling.  State replys to brief. Court finds no grounds & will deny motion.  State will comply with demands, if audio is available court will reserve defense right to refile motion. Atty Schuster may brief.  14CF246 State will agree to dismiss ct's 2 & 3.  Atty Schuster motion will be granted & dismiss ct's 2 & 3. Court will dismiss ct's 2 & 3 without prejudice.  15CF40 State amends Ct 2 attempt mnf amphetamine, as repeater, State will draft an amended information. Court will grant leave to amend ct 2 & reserve defense right to be heard.  State Exhibit #1 in 14CT85 received. Atty Schuster heard on schuduling. 14CT85 set for trial. Both 2014 cases to be set for status & follow.
Jury trial scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CT85, 14CF2146 and 15CF40 @ 9:44 a.m. Waiver of prelims filed for 14CF246 and 15CF40. Court reviews prelim waivers with Def, finds waivers knowingly and voluntarily made, finds probable cause and binds over. Informations filed. Copies received, reading waived. Not guilty pleas to all counts in both. Def requests reduction in bond. Arguments given by Atty Schuster, asks bond reduced to $2,000, $500 already posted. Response by State, objects to reducing bond. Court grants motion, gives reasons. $2,000.00 cash bond covers all three files, with conditions continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
No possession of Sudafed in any form

Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in court via video with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arguments for bond reduction.  Arguments presented by Atty Schuster for $2000.00 cash bond.  Reponse by Atty Uttke for bond to remain.  Court will reduce bond.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 09:30 am.
